results_summary: Time-averaged hemoglobin levels <100 g/l were associated with higher risks of all-cause mortality, MACE, and MACE+, but no associations were found with hospitalizations, transfer to hemodialysis, or first-episode peritonitis. Iron supplementation was noted as a factor predicting hemoglobin levels ≥100 g/l.
population_specificity: Incident peritoneal dialysis patients from a national-level database (n=2591).
study_duration: Follow-up from June 2016 to December 2020 (approximately 4.5 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of micronutrient-fortified balanced energy-protein (BEP) supplementation, including iron, during pregnancy on maternal and newborn body composition in rural Burkina Faso.
results_summary: Prenatal BEP supplementation significantly increased fat-free mass index (FFMI) in both mothers and newborns but had no significant effect on fat mass index (FMI). The effect on maternal FFMI was more pronounced in food-secure households and mothers with better baseline nutritional status.
population_specificity: Pregnant women (<21 weeks gestation) and their newborns in rural Burkina Faso.
effective_dosage: Not specified (micronutrient-fortified BEP + iron-folic acid tablets vs. iron-folic acid alone).
study_duration: From enrollment (<21 weeks gestation) until delivery (approximately 19-21 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of multiple micronutrient-fortified beverages, including iron, on childhood development and iron status among infants in Guatemala.
results_summary: The study found that 58% of infants were iron deficient at baseline, but the abstract does not provide specific endline results regarding iron's effects on development or iron status.
population_specificity: Infants aged 6-18 months in 72 community sectors in southwest Guatemala, with 55% anemic and 58% iron deficient at baseline.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of intravenous iron therapy (specifically ferric carboxymaltose) in improving quality of life, exercise capacity, and reducing hospitalizations in heart failure patients with iron deficiency, while also exploring unresolved clinical questions.
results_summary: Intravenous iron therapy with ferric carboxymaltose improved quality of life, exercise capacity, and symptoms in stable heart failure patients with iron deficiency, and reduced hospitalizations in post-acute heart failure patients. Oral iron therapy showed neutral effects, and potential interactions with sodium-glucose co-transporter type 2 inhibitors were noted as an area requiring further study.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure and iron deficiency, including stable and post-acute heart failure cases.
interactions: Possible interactions with sodium-glucose co-transporter type 2 inhibitors mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the treatment of anemia in hemodialysis patients, focusing on iron supplementation and its association with health-related quality of life.
results_summary: The study found that all patients requiring iron received intravenous iron sucrose (100 mg), but over half had hemoglobin levels below recommended targets. A significant association was observed between hemoglobin levels and quality of life.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients from three dialysis centers in Palestine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the benefits and harms of daily oral iron supplementation in non-anemic, iron-replete pregnant women.
results_summary: Daily iron supplementation probably reduces the risk of maternal iron deficiency anemia at term and low birthweight, based on data from 8 RCTs involving 2822 women. No observational studies met the inclusion criteria.
population_specificity: Non-anemic, iron-replete pregnant women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate how maternal iron supplementation interacts with genetic polymorphisms related to iron metabolism to influence birth outcomes.
results_summary: Iron supplementation significantly increased birth weight in women with higher genetic risk for low iron/hemoglobin status but showed a trend of decreasing birth weight in those with fewer risk alleles. Maternal genetic background played a key role in determining the efficacy of iron supplementation.
population_specificity: 860 pregnant women from Northwest China participating in a community-based randomized control trial.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of iron supplementation on cognitive development and function among school-age children through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Iron supplementation significantly improved intelligence, attention, concentration, and memory in school-age children, particularly among those who were anemic at baseline, but had no significant effect on school achievement.
population_specificity: School-age children (6-12 years old)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and biological activities of saccharide-iron (III) complexes (SICs) as novel iron supplements compared to traditional oral iron supplements.
results_summary: The study found that SICs have a high iron absorption rate, no gastrointestinal irritation, and exhibit beneficial effects in treating anemia, eliminating free radicals, and regulating immune response.
population_specificity: Not specified (general iron-deficient population implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess iron status in young male basketball players and evaluate the effect of iron supplementation on ferritin levels and sports performance.
results_summary: Iron supplementation increased ferritin levels, but only 15% of athletes achieved the target ferritin level (>100 μg/L), and no performance improvement was detected.
population_specificity: Young male basketball players (age 15.8 ± 1.7 years).
effective_dosage: 100 mg elemental iron (II) and 60 mg ascorbic acid daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of high-dose intravenous iron for treating iron-deficient anemia in critically ill patients, guided by hepcidin levels.
results_summary: The study found that iron-deficient anemia is frequent in critically ill patients and can be safely treated with high-dose intravenous iron when deficiency is confirmed by hepcidin levels, leading to favorable outcomes.
population_specificity: Critically ill patients, particularly those requiring continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT).
effective_dosage: High-dose intravenous iron (specific amount not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the prevalence and clinical characteristics of iron deficiency in hospitalized Korean patients with heart failure.
results_summary: The study found that iron deficiency was present in 53.8% of patients, with a higher prevalence in women (65.3%) than men (47.3%). The authors concluded that routine laboratory examinations are necessary to identify iron deficiency in these patients.
population_specificity: Hospitalized Korean patients with acute heart failure (mean age 67.6 years, 61.8% male).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if there is an association between iron intake and ovarian reserve among women seeking fertility care.
results_summary: Supplemental iron intake above 45 mg/day was associated with lower ovarian reserve, as indicated by reduced antral follicle count (AFC) and higher Day 3 FSH levels. The inverse relationship was dose-dependent, with higher supplemental iron intake leading to greater reductions in ovarian reserve markers.
population_specificity: Women seeking fertility treatment at the Massachusetts General Hospital Fertility Center (2007-2019).
effective_dosage: Supplemental iron intake categories: ≤20 mg/day, 45-64 mg/day, ≥65 mg/day.
study_duration: Observational study spanning 2007-2019 (exact intervention duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess dietary intake, energy availability, and blood biochemical parameters in elite wheelchair athletes across different training phases.
results_summary: The study reported mean daily nutritional intake for carbohydrates, protein, and fat in female and male athletes but did not specifically address Iron's effects.
population_specificity: Elite wheelchair athletes (14 participants, 8 females and 6 males, mean age 34 years).
study_duration: Data collected at four time points across four consecutive months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the toxicity of hemolytic by-products (Hb/h/Fe) and explore therapeutic strategies to mitigate their adverse effects.
results_summary: The study found that hemolysis leads to accumulation of Hb/h/Fe, causing vasoconstriction, hypertension, and oxidative organ damage. It highlighted ongoing development of scavenging therapies to counteract these effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of hemolysis and its by-products).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of a lower-dose, highly bioavailable iron amino acid chelate (ferrous bisglycinate) versus a standard-dose iron salt (ferrous sulfate) in increasing ferritin concentrations and assess potential impacts on gut inflammation and enteropathogen detection.
results_summary: Ferrous bisglycinate (18-mg) was less effective than ferrous sulfate (60-mg) in increasing ferritin concentrations, with no differences observed in gut inflammation or enteropathogen detection across groups. The study concluded that ferrous bisglycinate did not differentially influence gut health biomarkers in this predominantly iron-replete population.
population_specificity: Nonpregnant Cambodian women aged 18-45 years with low baseline anemia and iron deficiency prevalence (17% and 6%, respectively).
effective_dosage: 60-mg ferrous sulfate, 18-mg ferrous bisglycinate, or placebo, administered for 12 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of whole meat GSM powder on gut microbiota abundance, body composition, and iron status markers in healthy overweight or obese postmenopausal women.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding iron's effects.
population_specificity: Healthy postmenopausal women with a BMI between 25 and 35 kg/m².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review iron homeostasis during pregnancy and assess the balance between iron deficiency and excess, focusing on maternal, placental, and fetal health.
results_summary: The study highlights that while iron deficiency is linked to adverse pregnancy outcomes, excessive iron supplementation in high-resource settings may also pose risks. It discusses regulatory mechanisms from animal models and their potential relevance to human pregnancy.
population_specificity: Pregnant individuals, particularly in high-resource countries with iron-fortified diets.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the predictive ability of reticulocyte haemoglobin equivalent (RET-He) as an early marker of responsiveness to iron supplementation.
results_summary: RET-He measured at a single timepoint had poor predictive ability, but change in RET-He after 1 week strongly predicted haemoglobin response to iron supplementation. The study suggests RET-He can be a useful early indicator of iron therapy effectiveness.
population_specificity: 356 Cambodian women aged 18-45 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of extracellular hemoglobin (and its iron component) in secondary brain injury after aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (aSAH) and assess the potential of intrathecal haptoglobin as a therapeutic intervention.
results_summary: The study found that cell-free hemoglobin, derived from erythrocyte lysis, contributes to secondary brain injury via iron toxicity, oxidative stress, and inflammation. Intrathecal haptoglobin administration in animal models reversed hemoglobin-induced damage, suggesting potential efficacy in humans.
population_specificity: Mouse and sheep models, with Delphi consensus input from clinicians (n=72) and scientific experts (n=28) across 5 continents.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore ferroptosis, an iron-dependent cell death mechanism, as a potential alternative therapy for drug-resistant cancers.
results_summary: The study suggests that ferroptosis, regulated by iron and lipid peroxidation pathways, could be a promising cancer treatment, particularly for tumors resistant to apoptosis-based therapies. It highlights the need for precise control of nanocarriers to activate ferroptosis in the tumor microenvironment.
population_specificity: Not specified (implied focus on cancer cells or tumor models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of two oral iron supplements with differing bioavailability on the gut microbiomes of Cambodian women of reproductive age.
results_summary: The study compared ferrous sulfate and ferrous bisglycinate with a placebo over 12 weeks, assessing their impact on gut microbiomes, but specific results regarding efficacy or adverse effects were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Cambodian women of reproductive age (WRA) in a region with high anemia prevalence.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationship between dietary iron intake levels and sources (animal vs. plant) and their impact on mortality and clinical outcomes in adults initiating HAART for HIV.
results_summary: Higher intake of red meat (≥4 servings/week) and legumes (≥4 servings/week) was associated with lower risks of all-cause mortality, AIDS-related mortality, and severe anemia. Animal-sourced iron intake (highest quartile) also showed reduced mortality risks, while total dietary iron and plant-sourced iron showed no significant associations.
population_specificity: 2,293 adults living with HIV initiating HAART in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
effective_dosage: Not specified (assessed via food frequency questionnaire).
study_duration: Follow-up until death or censoring (duration not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of an integrated intervention, including nutritional supplementation, on improving children's iron status and overall development.
results_summary: The intervention significantly improved serum iron status (-0.36 SD) but showed no effect on hemoglobin levels or child growth.
population_specificity: Mothers with children aged 6-24 months in a low-income urban community in Dhaka who self-reported negative discipline.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of iron supplementation (oral or intravenous) in treating restless legs syndrome (RLS) and restless sleep disorder in children.
results_summary: Iron supplementation improved both nighttime and daytime symptoms in children with RLS and restless sleep disorder, as indicated by reduced large muscle movements during sleep and alleviation of daytime symptoms.
population_specificity: Children presenting with symptoms of insomnia, restless sleep, and decreased quality of life, diagnosed with RLS or restless sleep disorder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between iron and depression, focusing on its role in physiological processes like neural signal transmission, inflammation, and oxidative stress.
results_summary: The study suggests that iron, along with other mineral elements, may influence depression by modulating neural signaling, inflammation, and oxidative stress, but specific effects of iron alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion on depression and elements).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the adjunctive therapeutic effects of micronutrient supplementation, including iron, in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
results_summary: The abstract indicates that several clinical trials have been conducted on iron supplementation in IBD, but the current research is still preliminary, suggesting some evidence of efficacy without conclusive results.
population_specificity: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the effects of iron deficiency and overload on reproductive health in women of reproductive age (including pregnant women) and adult men, and to discuss appropriate iron levels and supplementation needs.
results_summary: The review found that iron deficiency and overload both impact reproductive health, with men needing to avoid iron overload, women requiring supplements before menopause, postmenopausal women needing to monitor for overload, and pregnant women benefiting from supplementation in later stages. Additional research is needed to understand underlying mechanisms.
population_specificity: Women of reproductive age (including pregnant women) and adult men.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of personal information sessions and home deliveries in increasing compliance with iron and folic acid (IFA) supplementation and malaria chemoprophylaxis, and their impact on postpartum anaemia and malaria infection.
results_summary: Neither intervention (INFO or INFO+DELIV) improved postpartum anaemia, but INFO+DELIV significantly reduced malaria parasitaemia by 83% and increased compliance with IFA supplementation and malaria prevention recommendations. However, the increase in IFA supplementation was deemed insufficient to address severe anaemia prevalence.
population_specificity: Pregnant women (age ≥15 years) in their first or second trimester in Taabo, Côte d'Ivoire.
study_duration: Trial conducted between 2020 and 2021 (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oral iron supplementation improves hemoglobin response and iron storage in patients with anemia following nonvariceal upper gastrointestinal bleeding (UGIB).
results_summary: Oral iron supplementation significantly improved hemoglobin response and iron storage compared to no supplementation, with no significant differences in adverse effects or adherence rates between groups.
population_specificity: Patients with anemia secondary to nonvariceal UGIB at discharge.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare morbidity symptoms among women receiving different nutrient supplements, including iron, during pregnancy and lactation.
results_summary: Most morbidity symptoms did not differ significantly among groups, though some minor differences were noted, such as lower vomiting prevalence in the LNS group in Ghana and higher severe diarrhea prevalence in the LNS group in Malawi. The study concluded that nutrient supplement type generally did not influence morbidity symptoms.
population_specificity: Pregnant and lactating women in Ghana (n=1320) and Malawi (n=1391).
effective_dosage: 60 mg iron and 400 µg folic acid daily until childbirth, then placebo.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of iron supplementation in managing symptoms of uterine fibroids, particularly anemia caused by abnormal menstrual bleeding.
results_summary: The abstract mentions iron supplementation as part of the treatment for uterine fibroids but does not provide specific results regarding its efficacy. It highlights the need for further research at the genetic level for better treatment insights.
population_specificity: Women of reproductive age with uterine fibroids.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if the effects of multiple micronutrient supplementation (MMS) versus iron and folic acid (IFA) on birth outcomes (low birthweight, preterm birth, small for gestational age) varied by gestational age assessment method.
results_summary: MMS showed consistent beneficial effects compared to IFA across all gestational age assessment methods, with significant reductions in low birthweight (RR 0.87) and small for gestational age (RR 0.9), and a non-significant trend for preterm birth (RR 0.90). Sensitivity analyses confirmed the robustness of these findings.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in low- and middle-income countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize evidence linking iron metabolism biomarkers with outcomes in heart failure patients to optimize biomarker use for patient selection.
results_summary: Iron deficiency was significantly associated with worse outcomes, including mortality, hospitalization rates, functional capacity, and quality of life. TSAT and ferritin were key predictors, but inconsistent biomarker associations highlight the need for further research.
population_specificity: Heart failure patients (age 53-79, 41-100% male), including reduced and preserved ejection fraction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential negative health effects of polyphenols, including their ability to block iron uptake, particularly in vulnerable subpopulations.
results_summary: The study highlights that polyphenols can inhibit iron absorption, which may be harmful in certain subpopulations, and discusses other adverse effects such as digestive enzyme inhibition, microbiota disruption, drug interactions, and hormonal imbalances.
population_specificity: Vulnerable subpopulations (specific groups not detailed in the abstract).
interactions: Mentioned interactions with drugs and potential disruption of intestinal microbiota.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of iron deficiency in exacerbating heavy metal toxicity in CKD patients and whether iron supplementation could mitigate these effects.
results_summary: The study hypothesizes that iron deficiency increases heavy metal uptake and retention in the kidneys, suggesting iron supplementation as a potential strategy to reduce heavy metal-related kidney damage in CKD patients.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify priority research gaps regarding dietary and lifestyle interventions, including iron supplements, in hidradenitis suppurativa (HS).
results_summary: The study found that "effects of iron supplements" were considered a low research priority by the expert panel, suggesting limited perceived impact on HS disease activity compared to other factors like obesity and smoking.
population_specificity: Patients with hidradenitis suppurativa (HS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility of a large RCT to evaluate intravenous iron therapy (IVIT) for improving patient well-being following orthopaedic injury, focusing on clinical and patient-reported outcomes.
results_summary: The abstract does not report specific results regarding Iron's effects, as it describes a pilot study focused on feasibility metrics (enrolment, follow-up, adverse events) rather than efficacy outcomes.
population_specificity: Adult patients admitted for lower extremity or pelvis operative fracture care with a haemoglobin of 7-11 g/dL within 7 days postoperatively.
effective_dosage: Single dose infusion of low-molecular weight iron dextran (1000 mg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether coadministration of prebiotic fibers (GOS, FOS, or acacia gum) enhances iron absorption from a high-dose (100 mg) ferrous fumarate supplement in iron-depleted women.
results_summary: GOS and FOS increased iron absorption by ~50% compared to control, resulting in an additional 10-12 mg of absorbed iron, while acacia gum had no significant effect. In vitro, iron dialyzability was 46% higher with GOS.
population_specificity: Iron-depleted women (serum ferritin <25 μg/L; median age 26.2 years).
effective_dosage: 100 mg Fe as ferrous fumarate, coadministered with 15 g GOS, FOS, or acacia gum.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a single dose of intravenous iron therapy versus 3-month oral iron administration on anemia in elderly patients following acute gastrointestinal bleeding.
results_summary: The study is ongoing, so results are not yet available. The primary endpoint includes all-cause mortality, anemia-associated unplanned emergency visits, and hospital admissions within 3 months of enrollment.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with acute non-variceal gastrointestinal bleeding.
effective_dosage: Intravenous ferric carboxymaltose (1000 mg) or oral ferrous sulfate (~200 mg daily).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between iron and thyroid diseases, focusing on its role in oxidative-antioxidant balance.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about iron's effects, only mentioning it as one of several trace elements potentially involved in thyroid disease and oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of thyroid diseases like thyroid cancer, Hashimoto's thyroiditis, and dysthyroidism).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of iron supplementation or multiple micronutrient powders (MNPs) on brain activity measures in young children using EEG.
results_summary: Iron syrup increased mu alpha-band power immediately after intervention, indicating potential short-term effects on brain activity related to motor action maturity, but no long-lasting changes in resting EEG power spectra were observed. MNPs did not show similar effects.
population_specificity: Young Bangladeshi children starting at 8 months of age, with baseline anemia (43.9%) and iron deficiency (26.7%).
effective_dosage: Daily iron syrup for 3 months (specific dosage not mentioned).
study_duration: 3 months of intervention, with follow-up at 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish consensus guidelines for the diagnosis and management of anemia in patients with epidermolysis bullosa (EB), including the use of iron supplementation.
results_summary: The study generated 26 consensus statements, resulting in 6 recommendations for managing anemia in EB patients. Iron supplementation (oral or infusion) was recommended based on anemia severity, with dietary measures advised for all patients.
population_specificity: Patients with moderate to severe forms of epidermolysis bullosa (EB).
effective_dosage: Not specified (oral iron for mild anemia; iron infusion for moderate to severe anemia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of weekly iron and folic acid (IFA) supplementation versus daily multiple micronutrient supplements (MMSs) in preventing anemia and improving school outcomes among adolescents.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as it describes a study protocol rather than completed findings.
population_specificity: Adolescents aged 10-17 in Burkina Faso and Tanzania.
effective_dosage: Weekly IFA or daily MMSs (specific amounts not detailed).
study_duration: 12 weeks in Burkina Faso; 1 year in Tanzania.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intravenous iron supplements reduced postoperative infection rates within 30 days in older adults after hip fracture surgery.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in infection rates between patients who received intravenous iron and those who did not, indicating no effect of iron supplementation on postoperative infections.
population_specificity: Ortho-geriatric patients (older adults) who underwent hip fracture surgery.

study_goal: The researchers examined the role of iron supplementation in addressing chronic sequela following trauma-induced coagulopathy.
results_summary: The abstract mentions iron supplementation as a potential intervention for chronic sequela post-trauma but does not provide specific findings on its effects.
population_specificity: Trauma patients with hemorrhage and trauma-induced coagulopathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether iron supplementation improves neural indices of habituation in children with high anemia prevalence.
results_summary: The study found no significant effects of iron supplementation (iron syrup or MNPs) on neural habituation indices, despite improvements in hemoglobin and ferritin levels. No differences were observed in primary or secondary outcomes at 3 or 12 months.
population_specificity: 8-month-old children in Bangladesh with >40% anemia prevalence.
effective_dosage: 12.5 mg iron daily (as iron syrup or in MNPs).
study_duration: 3 months of intervention, with follow-up at 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of synbiotic supplementation on haematological parameters and anaemia in haemodialysis patients.
results_summary: Synbiotic supplementation significantly improved blood haemoglobin, haematocrit, transferrin saturation, RBC count, and serum ferritin levels compared to placebo, while TIBC decreased significantly in the synbiotic group.
population_specificity: Haemodialysis patients from Vaseii Hospital, Sabzevar, Iran.
effective_dosage: 2 capsules of synbiotic supplement once a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the healthcare value and cost-effectiveness of Patient Blood Management (PBM) measures, including intravenous iron supplementation for iron-deficient anemic patients.
results_summary: The study found that intravenous iron supplementation in iron-deficient anemic patients improved surgical outcomes and reduced hospital length of stay, contributing to cost savings. However, comparing results across differing healthcare systems remains challenging.
population_specificity: Iron-deficient anemic patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of preoperative intravenous and oral iron supplementation in patients with colorectal cancer and iron deficiency anaemia.
results_summary: Normalisation of haemoglobin before surgery was infrequent with both treatments, but intravenous iron significantly improved haemoglobin levels at later timepoints. Restoration of iron stores was only feasible with intravenous iron, and no serious adverse events or deaths were observed.
population_specificity: Adult patients (aged 18 or older) with M0 stage colorectal cancer and iron deficiency anaemia scheduled for elective curative resection.
effective_dosage: 1-2 g of ferric carboxymaltose intravenously or three tablets of 200 mg oral ferrous fumarate daily.
study_duration: Median of 14 days (IQR 11-22) for intravenous iron and 19 days (IQR 13-27) for oral iron.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of high-dose vitamin D supplementation on hepcidin levels, erythropoiesis, and iron status in patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD).
results_summary: High-dose vitamin D supplementation had no overall effect on hepcidin or erythropoiesis markers in the entire cohort but showed beneficial effects on hemoglobin and iron availability in patients with low baseline vitamin D levels, while worsening iron status in those with high baseline levels.
population_specificity: Patients with CKD stage G3-G4.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of iron supplementation in suppressing periodic limb movements during sleep (PLMS) in patients with restless legs syndrome.
results_summary: The study found that iron supplementation showed promising but insufficient data for suppressing PLMS, with no significant effect demonstrated compared to other treatments like dopamine agonists.
population_specificity: Patients with restless legs syndrome experiencing periodic limb movements during sleep.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of public health education on the uptake of antenatal iron and folic acid supplementation (IFAS) to reduce anemia in pregnant women.
results_summary: The study found that daily IFAS is an efficacious strategy to reduce anemia risk and improve maternal and neonatal survival, but poor consumption persists due to limited knowledge and side effects. The trial will assess IFAS uptake through self-reports, pill counts, and clinical data.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in Kenya, particularly those attending antenatal clinics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intravenous iron supplementation (ferric carboxymaltose) improves humoral and cellular immune responses to SARS-CoV-2 vaccination in iron-deficient kidney transplant recipients.
results_summary: Intravenous iron supplementation effectively restored iron status but did not enhance humoral or cellular immune responses against SARS-CoV-2 after three vaccinations. Patients receiving FCM showed higher plasma ferritin and transferrin saturation but no improvement in vaccine efficacy.
population_specificity: Iron-deficient kidney transplant recipients
effective_dosage: 1-4 doses of 500mg FCM with six-week intervals
study_duration: Six-week intervals between doses (exact total duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether low-dose oral iron supplementation is effective for iron replacement in Japanese hemodialysis patients with well-controlled inflammation.
results_summary: The study found that 77.8% of treatment courses met effectiveness criteria, with CRP ≤ 0.1 mg/dL being a significant predictor of efficacy. Serum ferritin levels stabilized around 60 ng/mL during stable hematopoiesis, and reducing ESA dose correlated with positive hemoglobin fluctuations.
population_specificity: Outpatient hemodialysis patients in Japan with well-controlled inflammation.
effective_dosage: Low-dose oral iron (specific dosage not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether correcting iron deficiency in patients with severe aortic stenosis prior to TAVI improves functional outcomes, such as walking distance, quality of life, and muscle strength.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results as the study is ongoing; outcomes will be measured by 6MWT, quality of life, NYHA functional class, and skeletal muscle strength 3 months post-TAVI.
population_specificity: Patients with iron deficiency scheduled for TAVI due to severe aortic stenosis, excluding those with hemoglobin <10 g/dL, red blood cell disorders, kidney failure, intolerance to ferric derisomaltose, or ongoing infections.
study_duration: Approximately 3 months prior to TAVI, with follow-up 3 months post-TAVI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of oral probiotic supplementation on insulin levels and other outcomes in overweight and obese postmenopausal women.
results_summary: Probiotic supplementation reduced insulin levels (MD -4.20 IU/L) compared to placebo, though the confidence interval was wide (-8.11 to -0.30 IU/L). The study included 6 trials with 281 participants.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese postmenopausal women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine which sub-cohort of cardiac surgery patients benefits most from pre-operative hemoglobin optimization using oral Sucrosomial® iron, focusing on safety, efficacy, and cost-effectiveness.
results_summary: Sucrosomial® iron significantly increased hemoglobin levels (0.7 g/dL vs. 0.1 g/dL in controls) and reduced transfusion rates (30% vs. 59%) and transfusion index (0.5 vs. 1.2 units/patient), with notable cost-savings (€92/patient), especially in anemic patients.
population_specificity: Elective cardiac surgery patients with baseline hemoglobin data, excluding those receiving >5 red blood cell units or lacking baseline hemoglobin measurements.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of ferrous bisglycinate with other iron supplements on hemoglobin and ferritin concentrations and gastrointestinal adverse events in various populations.
results_summary: Ferrous bisglycinate resulted in higher hemoglobin concentrations and fewer gastrointestinal adverse events in pregnant women compared to other iron supplements, but no significant differences were observed in children. A non-significant trend for higher ferritin concentrations was noted in pregnant women.
population_specificity: Pregnant women (n=9), children (n=4), and other populations including men and nonpregnant women (n=4).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of oral iron supplementation (Ferrous Sulphate) on functional capacity in heart failure patients with iron deficiency anemia.
results_summary: Ferrous Sulphate significantly improved functional capacity (measured by a six-minute walk test) compared to placebo, with a mean improvement of 46.23 meters versus a decline of 13.7 meters in the placebo group after 12 weeks.
population_specificity: Heart failure patients with reduced ejection fraction (HFREF) and iron deficiency anemia (IDA).
effective_dosage: 200 mg Ferrous Sulphate three times a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of oral iron supplementation on cognitive function among children and adolescents in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs).
results_summary: Iron supplementation had a positive impact on intelligence test scores (SMD = 0.47) but no significant effects on attention, short-term memory, long-term memory, or school performance. Meta-regression indicated that higher iron doses correlated with greater improvements in intelligence scores.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents aged 5 to 19 in LMICs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding lipid-based multiple micronutrient supplements (LNS-PLW) to iron and folic acid (IFA) improved pregnancy and maternal outcomes in underweight pre-eclamptic women.
results_summary: The study found that LNS-PLW supplementation alongside IFA improved gestational age at delivery, Apgar scores, birth weight, diastolic blood pressure, and hemoglobin levels, with no significant adverse effects reported. However, there was no significant difference in live birth rates, systolic blood pressure, or platelet counts between the groups.
population_specificity: Underweight primigravida pre-eclamptic women from tertiary care hospitals in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Province, Pakistan.
effective_dosage: Iron (60 mg) and folic acid (400 µg) daily, plus an additional 75 g LNS-PLW sachet daily for Group 2.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether N-acetyl-L-cysteine (NAC) could protect against apical periodontitis in rats with adriamycin-induced kidney and heart diseases.
results_summary: NAC reduced elevated levels of inflammatory cytokines and hemodynamic markers, improved heart and kidney weight ratios, and decreased bone resorption in apical periodontitis. The results suggest NAC's antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects may mitigate damage in these conditions.
population_specificity: Wistar albino rats with induced kidney and heart diseases and apical periodontitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of L-cysteine metabolism-related proteins and antioxidative processes in melanoma cell proliferation under hypoxic conditions.
results_summary: Under hypoxia, inhibition of melanoma cell proliferation was linked to reduced expression of thioredoxin reductase-1 and cystathionine β-synthase. In normoxia, metastatic melanoma cells showed higher expression and activity of 3-mercaptopyruvate sulfurtransferase compared to primary melanoma cells.
population_specificity: Human primary (WM115) and metastatic (WM266-4) melanoma cell lines derived from the same individual.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of L-cysteine supplementation on the quality of boar semen stored at 5°C for 120 hours.
results_summary: L-cysteine supplementation improved sperm motility, with optimal effects observed at 1 mmol/L, and increased sulfhydryl content without affecting oxidative stress markers.
population_specificity: Normospermic boar ejaculates

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of NAC-loaded niosomes (NAC-NIO) for tumor treatment in mice, focusing on its antioxidant effects and tumor protection.
results_summary: NAC-NIO showed significant protection against tumor cells, reduced DNA injury, increased oxidative stress in tumor tissue, and upregulated caspase 3 and caspase 9 gene expression. Histological studies confirmed its protective effect, especially when administered during tumor growth.
population_specificity: Male BALB/c mice with induced tumors.
study_duration: Treatment began either at tumor injection or after tumor growth (day 14), but exact duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of L-cysteine-functionalized gold nanoparticles embedded in a covalent organic framework (Cys-AuNPs@COF) for removing Cr(VI) ions from wastewater.
results_summary: The study found that Cys-AuNPs@COF achieved a maximum adsorption capacity of 151.5 mg g⁻¹ for Cr(VI) ions, following the Langmuir model and pseudo-second-order kinetics. A portable smartphone-based colorimeter was also developed for in situ chromium detection.
population_specificity: Wastewater (environmental application, not human subjects).
